{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3136023,"name":"Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM","username":"Konnor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/konnor/{size}/246214_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-29T21:22:04.100Z","cooked":"

I have been wondering what gearbox is commonly used for mecanum. If my team ever does do mecanum it will probably just be a WCD chassis. What are some good recommendations I have found this gearbox but I don’t really know how good it is.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-29T21:22:04.100Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":171,"reads":226,"readers_count":225,"score":900.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":425051,"topic_slug":"mecanum-drive-gearbox","display_username":"Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-4156.html?q=&locale.name=English","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":63}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49593,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RetroBuzz | 5517AM YAGSL Contributor"},"post_url":"/t/mecanum-drive-gearbox/425051/1","custom_user_title":"RetroBuzz | 5517AM YAGSL Contributor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3136035,"name":"Ken Pontbriant","username":"electroken","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/electroken/{size}/160387_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-29T22:17:44.167Z","cooked":"

Four of our robots from the last 10 years used a West Coast Drive chassis with mecanum wheels. All four used AndyMark Toughbox Micro gearboxes and we never had a gearbox problem with any of them. All had 6" mecanums and gear ratios between 8.45:1 and 10.71:1.

We have no experience with the gearbox in your link.

Toughbox micro is the easy option if you run the KOP chassis.

In fact, Andymark sells kits to make it really easy if you have the KOP chassis already: AM14U5 (2023) Wheel Upgrades - AndyMark, Inc

If you have them, Rev says the Max Planetary work too. That is what we are running this year. We ran the toughbox micros in the past. If you look at the old upgrade kits, you can see their recommended gear ratios.

andymark.com

AM14U4/U5 Wheel Upgrade Kits - Drive Systems / Bases / Chassis - AndyMark, Inc

Upgrades - By Wheel Upgrade Bill of Materials Wheel UpgradesThe AM14U4 and AM14U5 support a multitude of wheel upgrade options. The six-wheel-drive drop center with six-inch HiGrip wheels that

We used the WCP SS gearbox last year on our mecanum chassis. (It looked a little different but I think this is the new one and it would work too, probably better)
Worked out beautifully for us.
Maybe a bit of overkill to have one of those for all 4 wheels, but it worked. You only need one motor and one pinion. You could make custom shorter spacers for it. Gear it for high speed.

I’m not sure which one would be best right now I am leaning towards the WCP SS gearbox since it appears like it would work the best for our chassis but we have the basic KOP WCD chassis kinda like the image below but 2-3 wheels depending on the year and mid-mounted gearboxes with usually 2 motors.

am-4980_OP6E670×670 26.9 KB

Here is a link to our cad from last year
Make sure you’re in the latest branch workspace, it should automatically go there but the link is funny sometimes.
Go to the chassis folder and there should be a chassis assembly in there. That’s the set up we used.

cad.onshape.com

Onshape

Sign in to Onshape, the #1 fastest growing CAD system in the world with over 2 million users.
